1. Paracetamol syrup 250mg/5ml ‚Äî 10ml every 6 hours
2. OR Nimesulide suspension 50mg/5ml ‚Äî 5ml every 8 hours
3. Cool water sponging if fever >38.5¬∞C

‚úì PRIMARY ADVICE: Monitor temperature closely, keep hydrated, avoid NSAIDs until dengue excluded.
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ MEDICINES (Specific for ADULT) ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ
1. Crocin 650mg ‚Äî 1-2 tablets every 6 hours
2. OR Dolo 500mg ‚Äî 1-2 tablets every 6 hours with food
3. Nimesulide 100mg ‚Äî 1 tablet every 8 hours if fever >101¬∞F
‚ö†Ô∏è  WARNING: Do not mix medicines. Take one at a time.
‚ö†Ô∏è  WARNING: Stop if any allergic reaction occurs.
‚è∞ MEDICINE TIMING: Every 6 hours after meals; max 3g/day
üçé RECOMMENDED FOODS (Specific for adult):
‚úì INCLUDE: Khichdi, Moong dal soup, Chicken broth, Boiled rice with curd
‚úó AVOID: Spicy, fried, oily, processed, and hard-to-digest foods
‚Ä¢ Eat 5-6 small meals instead of 3 large ones
‚Ä¢ All food should be warm, not cold from refrigerator
‚Ä¢ Maintain proper nutrition for immune system
üö´ STRICTLY AVOID These Foods:
‚Ä¢ Chili, peppers, spices - irritates stomach
‚Ä¢ Deep fried items - hard to digest
‚Ä¢ Chocolates, ice cream - worsens throat
‚Ä¢ Dairy (milk, cheese) if lactose intolerant - causes bloating
‚Ä¢ Nuts, seeds - difficult digestion
üíß HYDRATION & DRINKS:
Drink: Warm water with honey + lemon, Ginger-turmeric tea, Coconut water
‚Ä¢ Frequency: Every 30-60 minutes (small sips, not large gulps)
‚Ä¢ Total daily: Minimum 3-4 liters of fluids
‚úó AVOID: Cold water, cold drinks, alcohol, caffeine, carbonated drinks
üè• LIFESTYLE MODIFICATIONS:
1. Complete bed rest
2. Cold compress every 2 hours
3. Cotton clothes
üò¥ REST & SLEEP (CRITICAL):
‚Ä¢ Adults: Minimum 8 hours nightly
‚Ä¢ Power naps of 20-30 mins during day acceptable
‚Ä¢ Sleep deprivation delays recovery by 30%
üå°Ô∏è FEVER MANAGEMENT:
‚Ä¢ Check temperature every 4-6 hours
‚Ä¢ Use digital thermometer for accuracy
‚Ä¢ Record readings to show doctor if needed
‚Ä¢ Use cool water sponging for fever >101¬∞F
‚Ä¢ Cool compress on forehead and armpits
‚Ä¢ Maintain room temperature 68-72¬∞F
üßº HYGIENE & INFECTION PREVENTION:
‚Ä¢ Wash hands frequently with soap for 20 seconds
‚Ä¢ Use separate towels for yourself
‚Ä¢ Use separate utensils and dishes
‚Ä¢ Disinfect frequently touched surfaces (door handles, remote)
‚Ä¢ Cover nose/mouth when sneezing or coughing
‚Ä¢ Use handkerchief or tissue, not hands
üè† ROOM ENVIRONMENT & SETUP:
‚Ä¢ Room temperature: 68-72¬∞F
‚Ä¢ Good air circulation - open windows
‚Ä¢ Quiet, calm environment for rest
‚Ä¢ Use comfortable bedding
üö¥ ACTIVITY PROGRESSION PLAN:
Days 1-3: Complete bed rest
Days 4-5: Light movement around house
Days 6-7: Gentle walking
Week 2: Return to work if recovered
üö® EMERGENCY SIGNS - SEEK IMMEDIATE MEDICAL CARE:
üî¥ Fever >104¬∞F (40¬∞C) unresponsive to medication
üî¥ Severe difficulty breathing
üî¥ Chest pain or pressure
üî¥ Severe headache with neck stiffness
üî¥ Confusion or loss of consciousness
üî¥ Uncontrolled bleeding
üìã DAILY MONITORING & TRACKING:
‚úì Record temperature twice daily (morning and evening)
‚úì Track overall energy levels
‚úì Monitor fluid intake (should be 3-4 liters)
‚úì Note symptom progression daily
‚úì Contact doctor if symptoms persist >5-7 days
üìÖ FOLLOW-UP & CONSULTATION SCHEDULE:
‚Ä¢ Phone consultation within 24 hours
‚Ä¢ In-person visit if symptoms worsening by day 3
‚Ä¢ Follow-up check by day 7
‚Ä¢ Return to work when symptom-free (typically day 5-7)
‚ö†Ô∏è MEDICATION INTERACTIONS & WARNINGS:
‚Ä¢ Do NOT mix multiple fever medicines (can be toxic)
‚Ä¢ Do NOT take multiple brand names of same medicine
‚Ä¢ If taking other chronic medicines, inform doctor
‚Ä¢ Do NOT take alcohol with any medication
‚Ä¢ Wait at least 4-6 hours between different medicines
‚úÖ WHEN SAFE TO RESUME NORMAL ACTIVITIES:
‚Ä¢ Work: After 5-7 days when strength returns
‚Ä¢ Exercise: After 1 week recovery minimum
‚Ä¢ Normal diet: After 3-4 days when symptoms improve
‚Ä¢ Social activities: After symptoms completely resolve
üìä DIET PROGRESSION OVER RECOVERY PERIOD:
Day 1-2: Liquids only (water, juices, soup)
Day 3-4: Soft foods (rice, dal, bread, banana)
Day 5-7: Normal diet with restrictions (no spicy/fried)
Week 2+: Gradual return to full normal diet
üë• PROTECT FAMILY & CLOSE CONTACTS:
‚Ä¢ Isolate from family members if possible
‚Ä¢ Use separate bedroom if available
‚Ä¢ Minimize contact with elderly & young children
‚Ä¢ Family members: Wash hands frequently
‚Ä¢ Family members: Maintain good nutrition & sleep
‚Ä¢ Inform close contacts about your condition
üß† MENTAL & EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING:
‚Ä¢ Maintain positive outlook - helps immune system
‚Ä¢ Avoid stress and excessive worrying
‚Ä¢ Stay connected with support system
‚Ä¢ Light entertainment during recovery (reading, music)
üõ°Ô∏è SPECIAL PRECAUTIONS & DO's:
‚úì DO keep updated on recovery progress
‚úì DO follow doctor's advice strictly
‚úì DO rest when tired - don't push yourself
‚úì DO maintain good hygiene
‚úì DO stay hydrated constantly
‚úì DO inform doctor of any new symptoms
‚úó DON'T ignore warning signs
‚úó DON'T return to activities too early
‚úó DON'T take unnecessary medications
‚úó DON'T ignore complications
